location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 7118/42 ' Introduction to English for Persian Speakersby Col Yakub Khan'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 8; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a request from the British Council for copies of Introduction to English for Persian Speakers, written by Codrington with Colonel Yakub Khan, to be sent to London. The British Ministry in Kabul informs the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs and the India Office, that Colonel Khan was in jail in Kabul for political reasons.

name.namePart: Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs
